author: Special Correspondent
text:
In the run up to the forthcoming assembly elections, the Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order) J.K. Tripathy on Thursday convened a meeting with top police officers of the central zone to discuss on poll preparedness.

Organised at the District Police Office here, the meeting was attended by the Inspector General of Police, Central Zone N.K. Senthamaraikannan, Commissioner of Police Sanjay Mathur, Deputy Inspector General of Police of Tiruchi and Thanjavur ranges and Superintendent of Police of Tiruchi, Pudukottai, Thanjavur, Perambalur, Karur, Ariyalur, Tiruvarur and Nagapattinam districts.

Police sources said the Election Commission directives, its recent instructions and the precautionary measures to be taken pertaining to policing and security were discussed at the meeting.

The measures to be put in place during pre-poll, on the day of polling and after the election were also put forth at the meeting that lasted around five hours.

With VIP movements to be frequent ahead of the polls, the meeting also touched on the subject of security for VIPs.
title: ADGP holds meeting on poll preparedness
